result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DE employer called- did not receive the paperwork for this until today.(was due on 11/1) Said her payroll for this week went out already. He gets paid bi-weekly. Will be on his next paycheck.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant James A Meller in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Meller states that he does not qualify for SPD. Court will allow an adjournment to hire his own counsel, given court appointed paperwork in Court, continues bond, sets for AIA on 10/12/22 at 9:15 AM, defendant will be filling form out now and will give it to the JA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
No contact with Lake Avenue Restaurant.

9:41 AM Defendant James A Meller in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has not. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney; private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Defendant understands and will contact a private attorney. State asks for $1000 signature bond, no contact with Lake Avenue Restaurant. Court imposes $1000 signature bond, no contact with Lake Avenue Restaurant and will have set for AIA. Meller indicates the complaint does not have anything about the interview he had with Officer Bath. Court indicates not here for that today and can be taken up with attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
